name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-graph-schema-extensions
title: Read / update MS Graph Custom Schema Extensions
shortDescription: This sample shows how read and update a custom Schema extension in MS Graph. It shows how to create a custom Schema extension in Graph to store custom data related to an Office 365 Group, and how we can read and update that data using an spfx web part.
longDescription: This sample shows how read and update a custom Schema extension in MS Graph. It shows how to create a custom Schema extension in Graph to store custom data related to an Office 365 Group, and how we can read and update that data using an spfx web part.

thumbnails.alt: Read / update MS Graph Custom Schema Extensions

references.name: Build your first SharePoint client-side web part
references.description: Client-side web parts are client-side components that run in the context of a SharePoint page. Client-side web parts can be deployed to SharePoint environments that support the SharePoint Framework. You can also use modern JavaScript web frameworks, tools, and libraries to build them.
